section.p: This topic describes how to use the MiramoPDF - generate new plugin transformation scenario in to create a new custom plugin.

li.p: In , choose Options Import Transformation Scenarios .
Navigate to your installation folder, for example C:\Program Files\Oxygen XML Editor 21\frameworks\dita\DITA-OT3.x\plugins\com.miramo.mmpdf\integration\oxygen .
In the Import scenarios dialog, select Project Options and click Import.
Create or open any DITA file.

itemgroup.p: You can open a DITA file in the following Samples folder:

li.p: Click the Configure Transformation Scenario button.
In the Configure Transformation Scenarios dialog, select the MiramoPDF - generate new plugin transformation scenario and click Edit.
Click the Parameters tab and change the plugin-name and transtype parameters, as shown in the example below.

itemgroup.p: A transtype is a new transformation type with any new custom parameters that are supported. In this case, the transtype is the transformation with customizations done in a custom.xsl file.

li.p: Click OK and then Apply associated to run the transformation scenario.
li.itemgroup: In your DITA-OT installation folder, you will now find your custom plugin folder where you can make the necessary customizations in the cfg\xsl\custom.xsl file.

li.p: Navigate to your newly created, custom folder.
li.itemgroup: For example: C:\Program Files\Oxygen XML Editor 21\frameworks\dita\DITA-OT3.x\plugins\com.miramo.flow-mmpdf .

li.p: Select the .scenarios file, for example com.miramo.flow-mmpdf.scenarios, and click Open.
In the Import scenarios dialog, select Project Options and click Import.
Click the Configure Transformation Scenario button again.
li.itemgroup: Your new custom transformation scenario is now ready for use.

li.p: You can click Apply associated to test your custom transformation scenario.
